channel.title: Smithing error...?

item.title: Smithing error...?
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

O haha im an idiot… I forgot that after that bracket there were still more lines of codes…

mehh FML… careless errors suck

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing error...?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“pesterd, post:3, topic:283036”][quote author=Avalon link=topic=374012.msg2820810#msg2820810 date=1244586143]

} else {
	return false;

Change to:

else {
	return false;

I believe that should work.

[/quote]

Mehhh… Wrong dudeee

From:

} else {
           return false;

To:

	} else 
	return false;

You just removed a closing bracket and replaced it with an opening right at the end of the code… Now that wasn’t very smart

Creds To me Hehe[/quote]
Erm, Avalon was correct. He had an extra closing curly brace. Why would you remove an opening curly brace that serves a function?

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing error...?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

[quote=“pesterd, post:3, topic:283036”][quote author=Avalon link=topic=374012.msg2820810#msg2820810 date=1244586143]

} else {
	return false;

Change to:

else {
	return false;

I believe that should work.

[/quote]

Mehhh… Wrong dudeee

From:

} else {
           return false;

To:

	} else 
	return false;

You just removed a closing bracket and replaced it with an opening right at the end of the code… Now that wasn’t very smart

Creds To me Hehe[/quote]

No, that ‘}’ before the else ends the method and causes the errors. I’m assuming that he just omitted a few closing braces in what he posted 'cuz there would probably be more errors if he actually missed them.

Read full topic

item.title: Smithing error...?
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

[quote=“Avalon, post:2, topic:283036”] } else { return false;

Change to:

else {
	return false;

I believe that should work.[/quote]

Mehhh… Wrong dudeee

From:

} else {
           return false;

To:

	} else 
	return false;

You just removed a closing bracket and replaced it with an opening right at the end of the code… Now that wasn’t very smart

item.title: Smithing error...?
item.dc:creator: @Avalon Avalon
item.description:
@Avalon wrote:

} else {
	return false;

Change to:

else {
	return false;

I believe that should work.
